Package propra.imageconverter.handler

Class ArgumentHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • propra.imageconverter.handler.ArgumentHandler
  • public class ArgumentHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Argument handler handles the arguments that are passed to the ImageConverter program. This handler is used on one hand to check the passed arguments, if they are valid, and prepares on the other hand the arguments in a format, that is suitable for further processing during the conversion process.

      • validateArgs

        private void validateArgs​(java.lang.String[] args)
                   throws ImageConverterIllegalArgumentException
        Validate whether passed arguments to program ar valid. Checks on one hand for the number of arguments (which should be two) and on the other hand, if the arguments are in an expected format.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments passed to the ImageConverter program.
        Throws:
        ImageConverterIllegalArgumentException - If number of arguments if not two, or if arguments have wrong format.

      • getUsage

        public java.lang.String getUsage()
        Get usage for ImageConverter program for users to know, how the program should be called.
        Returns:
        String that gets printed to console window and shows the two ways, the program can be called.
